description: Updates a monitor probe. This action requires both the monitorName and probeId parameters. Run ListMonitors to get a list of monitor names. Run GetMonitor to get a list of probes and probe IDs. You can update the following para create a monitor with probes using this command. For each probe, you define the following:

parameters.name: monitorName
parameters.description: The name of the monitor that the probe was updated for.

parameters.name: probeId
parameters.description: The ID of the probe to update.

nested_items.name: probeId
nested_items.description: The updated ID of the probe.

nested_items.name: probeArn
nested_items.description: The updated ARN of the probe.

nested_items.name: sourceArn
nested_items.description: The updated ARN of the source subnet.

nested_items.name: destination
nested_items.description: The updated destination IP address for the probe.

nested_items.name: destinationPort
nested_items.description: The updated destination port. This must be a number between 1 and 65536.

nested_items.name: protocol
nested_items.description: The updated protocol for the probe.

nested_items.name: packetSize
nested_items.description: The updated packet size for the probe.

nested_items.name: addressFamily
nested_items.description: The updated IP address family. This must be either IPV4 or IPV6.

nested_items.name: vpcId
nested_items.description: The updated ID of the source VPC subnet ID.

nested_items.name: state
nested_items.description: The state of the updated probe.

nested_items.name: createdAt
nested_items.description: The time and date that the probe was created.

nested_items.name: modifiedAt
nested_items.description: The time and date that the probe was last updated.
